info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 5:14PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Kane County through 545 PM CDT... At 514 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Elburn, or 10 miles southwest of Campton Hills, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Aurora, Batavia, Geneva, Montgomery, North Aurora, Sugar Grove, Elburn, Big Rock and Kaneville. Including the following interstate... I-88 between mile markers 103 and 120. This includes... Aurora University, Fermilab, IL Math and Science Academy, and Waubonsee Community College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for northeastern Illinois.
